titles: Jus populi vindicatum, or, The peoples right to defend themselves and their covenanted religion vindicated wherein the act of defence and vindication which was interprised anno 1666 is particularly justified ... being a reply to the first part of Survey of Naphtaly &c. / by a friend to true Christian liberty.
author: Stewart, James, Sir, 1635-1713.
notes: Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
Imperfect: stained and torn with loss of print.
keywords: Honyman, Andrew, 1619-1676. --  Survey of the insolent and infamous libel entituled, Naphtali &c.
